intro: Staphylea robusta, commonly known as the common hazel, is a deciduous shrub native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Betulaceae and is characterized by its compound leaves and small, yellowish flowers that appear in early spring. The plant produces edible nuts enclosed in a spiky husk, which are a food source for various wildlife species. Staphylea robusta typically grows in woodland areas and thrives in well-drained soils. Its ornamental value is also appreciated for its attractive foliage and autumn coloration.
